projects.title: Codex
projects.description: Data management system for construction cooperative.

largeDescription.intro: This project emerged from an internship at COOPTEBA, a housing construction cooperative for teachers. There we faced the problem of designing a web page for managing construction zone data, as until then all this data was handled on paper and/or disorganized in a drive.
points: Intuitive and simple design, as most users are older adults
Clear user hierarchy, only the cooperative owner could add or delete users
Action logging, they needed a record of all actions performed by users
largeDescription.development:
Following these points and others that emerged in various interviews, we managed to create a web page that fits the cooperative's needs and is easy to use for all users.

To program the product we had to train in various technologies. A colleague and I worked on Front End design with React, HTML/CSS and JavaScript (only React was new to us), while 2 other colleagues trained in Back End with Java, Springboot and MySQL. We also used many tools like Postman, Git, GitHub, Jira, etc.
largeDescription.achievement: This project was presented at ExpoProyecto 2024 organized by the National University of La Matanza, winning the award for innovation and originality, due to the innovative data management approach never before seen for a construction cooperative.

largeDescription.intro: This is a school group project created to digitize school attendance records, with the idea of implementing additional modules for grade management, evaluations, etc.
points: Responsive design, the main idea is that it can be used on any device to take attendance and more
Clear user hierarchy: principals manage supervisors, supervisors manage teachers, and teachers manage students
Scalability, since the idea was to make it as complete as possible in the future, we had to be careful with how we programmed to avoid future problems
largeDescription.development: For programming we used React, Bootstrap to make it responsive, HTML, CSS and JavaScript for Front End (where I was in charge), and Java, SpringBoot and MySQL for Back End. We also used Github for version control and JWT for login sessions.

projects.title: LED Controller
projects.description: LED controller for stock management in factory.

largeDescription.intro: I was commissioned to create this LED manager for a factory to be used on a stock shelf where GREEN means there is stock and RED means there isn't. This required controlling the LEDs individually for each shelf compartment.
points: The LED states had to be saved under any circumstances
The LED response had to be in real time
We had to avoid any problems with the microcontroller code, since if there were issues, uploading and testing new code would be problematic due to the distance between the ESP8266 and me
largeDescription.development:
When starting to program, I had to research how to save an LED state without resetting when powered off. I solved this using SPIFFS, a reduced file system available in ESP32 and ESP8266, where I created a JSON to save each LED state.

For constant real-time connection with the page we used the WebSockets function of the ESP, so through page requests the LED states change and the LED states are also shown on the page.
largeDescription.conclusion: Finally, I considered every possible data corruption scenario that could occur in the JSON managed by the microcontroller, ensuring there would never be problems with LED control.
